version_description:
NEW: 3 second countdown option for Apple Watch timer. Now you can choose from 5 seconds, 3 seconds, End of Interval, or None.
FIX: Indoor workouts are now displayed in Apple Health and Activity apps as expected. Previously, they displayed as Outdoor.
FIX: Tapping Pause, Resume, Prev, and Next buttons on the Apple Watch would occasionally not automatically move you back to the timer view.

If you love Intervals, I'd appreciate a rating or short review. Just tap 'Leave a Review' on the Setting tab.
If you have questions, problems, or suggestions, please send feedback. Just tap 'Send Feedback' on the Setting tab and I will respond to you!

Happy Workouts!

Intervals 4 is the next major version of the fastest growing Interval Timer for the iPhone, iPad and Apple Watch. The focus of this release is much deeper Apple Health integration along with many highly requested new features.

NEW: Save iPhone workouts to HealthKit
NEW: Workout History directly in the app
NEW: Share Interval Timers with friends
NEW: Show pace on the Apple Watch (current pace, interval pace, or average pace for the workout)
NEW: Display distance in miles or kilometers
NEW: Control the Alert volume relative to other audio
NEW: Text drive Custom Timer creation before you decide to upgrade to Intervals Pro
FIX: The total length of custom timers was incorrect for some timers

If you have questions, problems, or suggestions, please tap 'Send Feedback' on the Settings tab.

Help keep Intervals growing by leaving a rating or short review. Just tap 'Leave a Review' on the Settings tab. Thanks and happy workouts!

4.0.1: Fixed the default for existing timers for the new Track Workout in Apple Health setting. If you upgraded previously to 4.0 and have a timer on your Apple Watch that says Apple Health is disabled, you can simply edit the timer, tap on Apple Health Workout Settings, and enable the Track Workout in Apple Health switch.

NEW: Control the Alert volume relative to other audio
NEW: Text drive Custom Timer creation before you decide to upgrade to Intervals Pro
FIX: The total length of custom timers was incorrect for some timers

If you have questions, problems, or suggestions, please tap 'Send Feedback' on the Settings tab.

4.0.2: Minor bug fixes

version_name: 4.0.4FIX: Starting a timer will no longer pause audio from other applications.Intervals 4 is the next major version of the fastest growing Interval Timer for the iPhone

version_description:

version_name: 4.1.1: Minor fixes and improvements.Version 4.1: Great news! The free version of Intervals now includes:• Monitoring heart rate

version_description:
Great news! The free version of Intervals now includes:
• Monitoring heart rate, calories, distance and pace on the Apple Watch.
• Saving your workouts to Apple Health.
• Viewing your last saved workout in the Workout History tab.

Also, this release has the following improvements:
• FIX: All day intervals timers would sometimes pause.
• FIX: Using the Share Sheet to share a timer with yourself would not save to iCloud correctly.

Enjoy and Happy Workouts!

version_name: 4.1.1: Improved synchronization between iPhone and Apple WatchVersion 4.1: Great news! The free version of Intervals now includes:• Monitoring heart rate

version_description:
Version 4.1.1: Minor fixes and improvements.
Version 4.1: Great news! The free version of Intervals now includes:
• Monitoring heart rate, calories, distance and pace on the Apple Watch.
• Saving your workouts to Apple Health.
• Viewing your last saved workout in the Workout History tab.

Version 4.1.1: Improved synchronization between iPhone and Apple Watch
Version 4.1: Great news! The free version of Intervals now includes:
• Monitoring heart rate, calories, distance and pace on the Apple Watch.
• Saving your workouts to Apple Health.
• Viewing your last saved workout in the Workout History tab.

• Mindful Minutes! Do you use Intervals as a meditation or mindfulness timer? Now you can configure the timer to save Mindful Minutes to Apple Health.
• Improved control of Apple Watch Haptics and Alerts. If you love the new Text-to-Speech and Alert sounds on the Apple Watch, but wish they only played when bluetooth headphones are connected to the watch, then this feature is for you. Tap on Settings (gear icon) and then Apple Watch Settings to configure haptics and alert sounds.

• Select Language and Voice. Now you can select the language and voice to use for all spoken alerts.
• Localized Spoken Alerts. All spoken alerts are now localized to 10 languages. Chinese (simplified), Danish, Dutch, French, German, Italian, Norwegian, Polish, Spanish, and Swedish are all supported.
• Quickly Skip to the Cool Down Interval. Now you can quickly skip ahead to the cool down interval when you want to end the workout early.

• Spoken Interval Durations. One less reason to look at your phone or watch! The length of the interval (time or distance) is now automatically spoken when the interval starts. You can control this feature in Settings->Sound & Speech.
• Zero to 5K Training Program. Intervals Pro users can now create a nine week Zero to 5K Training Program with just a tap. For Apple Watch owners, no other 5K training program lets you leave your phone at home!

• GPS Strength Indicator on Watch. Running and other distance tracked workouts now show a GPS signal strength indicator of zero to three dots.
• Improved Distance & Route Tracking.

Happy Workouts!

• Interval statistics now take timer pauses into account when calculating interval duration and pace.
• GPS Strength Indicator on Watch (zero to 3 dots).
• Improved Distance & Route Tracking.
Happy Workouts!
Improvements to distance tracking for the Apple Watch.

• Now Playing support on Apple Watch. For watchOS 5 users, you can swipe to the Now Playing screen in Intervals to easily control music or podcasts during your workout.
• New Apple Watch screen order. Similar to the Apple Watch Workout app, the timer list is now the first screen, the current timer is the second screen, and the "Now Playing" screen is last.
• Other bug fixes and improvements.

• Fix for the active timer display not showing the bottom status line for the 40mm Series 4 Apple Watch
• Fix for location services continuing after the timer is complete. The GPS signal strength will now only display while the timer is running
Happy Workouts!

Fix for color picker display issues
Happy Workouts!

• Siri Shortcuts Support. Edit any timer and tap "Add to Siri". Any started timer will also be donated as a Siri Suggestion.
• watchOS 5 Workout Tracking. Intervals Pro takes advantage of improved workout tracking in watchOS 5.
• Complication Support for the New Infograph Watch Faces. Intervals now provides complication support for Infograph and Infograph Modular watch faces. Includes showing the status of your running timer!
• New Apple Watch Quick Tap Action. Moving to the previous interval has been added to Quick Tap Actions. Configure in Settings->Apple Watch Settings.
• Improved Heart Rate Monitoring for iPhone". Using an external heart rate monitor with Intervals on the iPhone is now more reliable. Settings->Details now displays the last heart rate and date from the connected external heart rate monitor.
• Other fixes and Improvements. Fixed an iCloud syncing issue. Improved handling for timer pause/resumes when the side button and digital crown are pressed.
Bug Fixes and Improvements. Includes an improved error message when the timer can't be started on the Apple Watch because Apple Health permissions have not been granted.

• Fix to discard unsaved Apple Health Workouts.
• Improved handling of timers without fitness tracking enabled.

Reduced the size of the Apple Watch app by more than 50%.
Happy Workouts!

• Heart Rate Range Alerts. New audible alerts when your heart rate goes out of the range you specify for an interval.
• Improved Workout Route Tracking. Additional filtering was added to remove bad GPS locations.
Happy Workouts!

• New Advanced Set Timer. Easily create complex timers with repeating sets of custom intervals!
• New Interval Colors. Six new interval color choices are available!
• Other fixes and improvements. Includes visual improvements to the Start/Pause/Resume button.

Intervals 7.1 is all about more customization...
• Interval Timer Templates. Do you have favorite defaults when creating new timers? Now you can customize the templates used to create them. Just tap Settings->Details to get started.
• More Alert Customization. Now you can customize alert sounds for timer complete, halfway there, heart rate ranges, and more. Tap on Settings->Sound & Speech Settings to get started.
• iCloud Settings. It's easier to use Intervals on multiple devices or upgrade to a new iPhone or iPad. Settings are now automatically synced between all your devices.
• GPS Signal Strength for iPhone. Timers on the iPhone that track distance now show the GPS signal strength while the timer is running.
• Other fixes and improvements. Includes a fix for resetting the relative volume when using the remote watch view.

• New 3 Minute Plank Challenge. Start the new year off right! Gather your co-workers, friends, or family for a daily planks challenge.
• Improved iPhone route & distance tracking. Improved the accuracy of location tracking on the iPhone.
• Active Energy kJ Support. The Active Energy unit (kcal or kJ) you specify in the Apple Health app will now be used by Intervals Pro.
• Other fixes and improvements. Includes improvements for deleting saved Apple Health workouts.

• Now you can easily extend workouts. Have you ever almost reached the end of your workout, but wanted to keep going? Now you can quickly jump to the first interval after the warmup. Just tap the button to end the workout on your iPhone or Apple Watch and choose the "Restart" option.
• Other fixes and improvements. Restored support for some timers that used an older file format.

Fix for an iCloud syncing issue.
Happy Workouts and don't forget to try out the new 3 Minute Plank Challenge with your co-workers and friends!

• Get prepared for the next interval. Now you can get a spoken alert with the next interval name as soon as a new interval starts. Edit the timer and scroll down to the Advanced section to enable this option.
• Skip the last rest interval. With some workouts you might want to skip the last rest interval before the cool down interval.
• Randomize your workouts. Mix it up a little bit with your next workout. Enable the Randomize Order option and the order of intervals will be randomized with each run of the timer.
• Configure distance intervals with the HIIT Timer. Now all the timer types support distance based intervals. Just edit any interval's duration and you can choose between time and distance.
• Customize recovery between cycles. Now you can customize the recovery interval just like any other interval.
• Other fixes and improvements. Includes improvements to iCloud syncing.
Happy Workouts!

• Improvements to the new "skip last rest interval" option. It now only skips the very last reset interval even if the workout has multiple cycles.
Happy Workouts!

• Total workout time now reflects the value of the "skip last interval" setting.
Happy Workouts!

• iCloud sync improvements.
• Other fixes and improvements. Includes a change to no longer track workout routes for any indoor workout.

• New 4x4 Running Workout. 4 rounds of 4 minutes of high intensity exercise. A highly effective HIIT workout researched by CERG (Cardiac Exercise Research Group) in Norway.
• Add New Timer Improvements. Intervals Pro has 3 types of timers, 5 workout templates, and a 5K training program. Now its easier to choose which one is right for you with a redesigned Add Timer dialog.

• New option to continue the workout until stopped. Great for runs and other types of interval training where you want to continue repeating the intervals until you're ready to finish. Just edit the timer and change the 'Number of Cycles' to 'Until Stopped'.
• Bug fixes and improvements. Fixed an issue where default alerts could not be set to 'Text to Speech'.

Improvements to the "Continue until stopped" feature to work correctly with distance duration intervals.
Happy Workouts!
Bug fix to remove a sneak peak of an upcoming feature. Stay tuned :)
Minor bug fixes. Happy Workouts!

• New Halfway Done Alert. When enabled, a new spoken alert will notify you when the workout is halfway complete.
• New Time & Distance Goals. Now you can set time and distance goals for your workout and get spoken alerts when reached. Great for running and other workouts where you set the number of cycles to "Until Stopped" and you want to be notified when you reach your goal. Edit the timer and scroll to the Advanced settings section to get started with both of these new features.

• None to Run Training Plan. Intervals Pro has partnered with None to Run™ to bring you a 12-week running plan for beginner runners (upgrade required).
• Share Completed Workouts on Social Media. New Share Cards let you share your completed workouts to Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Mail, iMessage and more.

7.8.1 fixes a couple of minor issues for our latest release:
• None to Run™ Training Plan. Intervals Pro has partnered with None to Run™ to bring you a 12-week running plan for beginner runners (upgrade required).
• Share Completed Workouts on Social Media. New Share Cards let you share your completed workouts to Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Mail, iMessage and more.

• Halfway Done Alert. Know when to turn around and head home! The alert when your workout is halfway complete is now enabled by default for all newly created timers for running workouts. For existing timers of any type, you can easily turn it on in the Advanced section when you edit the timer.
• Heart Rate Monitoring Improvement. Now you can just set either the high or low target heart rate if desired. No need to set both if that's not what you want.
Minor fixes. Happy Workouts!
Minor fixes and improvements. Happy Workouts!
Minor bug fixes and improvements for the iOS and Apple Watch apps.
Bug fixes and improvements. Happy Workouts!

• Timer pause & resume voice alerts for iPhone. New voice alerts on iPhone when a timer is paused or resumed. These alerts are also available in the Apple Watch app.
• Bug fixes and improvements.
Happy Workouts!

• Pause/Resume Alert Sound: The default alert for pause/resume is spoken text, but it can now be customized by changing the "Default Alert" sound in "Sound & Speech Settings".
• Support for the original Apple Watch: Re-added support for the original Apple Watch and watchOS 4.3.
Happy Workouts!
Includes an iOS 13/watchOS 6 fix that could occasionally cause the timer to crash if you were using a music or audio app at the same time.
Fixes and improvements to our big iOS 13 & watchOS 6 update. Includes improvements for reordering timers.
Bug fixes and improvements.

• User Switchable Light/Dark Appearance: Now you can use dark appearance even if your device is set to light appearance!
• New Split Alerts: Distance and pace are now announced for each split.
• Improved Apple Watch "Quick Tap Alerts": The "Workout Status" quick tap alert now includes interval time remaining, heart rate, and distance/pace (if applicable).
• 10 Second Apple Watch Countdown Haptic Alert: A 10 second option was added to the Apple Watch Haptic Alert.
• Disable Apple Watch Remote Display: You can now disable the Apple Watch Remote display and alerts by tapping on the speaker icon on the Remote tab.
• Other Bug fixes and improvements.
Happy Workouts!

• Improved Apple Watch Calorie Tracking: In addition to active energy, basal energy (BMR) is now tracked during your Apple Watch workout. This provides a better representation of total calories in the Apple Activity App and in Apple Health.
• Bug fixes and improvements: Fixed a rare Apple Watch workout location issue which caused the workout location to not be correctly recorded and active calories not to be tracked for some workouts. Fixed a Distance Goal issue where a goal of zero would cause distance to be repeated continuously. Distance goals of zero are now ignored.

• Running Pace Notifications. Get notified when you're running too fast or slow. Pace targets can be set for each interval.
• Improved iPhone Calorie Tracking. Calorie tracking on the iPhone now takes into account the time paused during your workout.
• Other fixes and improvements.
Fixes and improvements. Includes fixing an issue where the target pace was not saved for Set Timers. The type of timer is now displayed on the timer overview screen.

• Auto Pause Workouts: Running, Walking & Cycling workouts can now be paused automatically when motion is stopped. When motion resumes the workout will continue automatically.
• Improved Pace Tracking: Current pace and pace targets now use an improved method to calculate pace. You will be prompted for the app to access Motion & Fitness Activity.
• Improvements on Apple Watch when Fitness Tracking is disabled. Intervals Pro allows you to run the Apple Watch Workout app or another fitness app at the same time as Intervals Pro when you disable Fitness Tracking. Now distance tracking is supported in this mode as well as intervals that specify a distance duration.

• VoiceOver Improvements: A number of fixes and improvements to VoiceOver on Apple Watch, including fixing an issue when selecting a new timer.
• Other Fixes & Improvements: Fixed an issue to ensure location tracking is turned off when a timer ends. Also, you can now import a timer from the iOS Files app.

• Cadence Tracking: Running and walking workouts now track cadence. Steps and cadence are displayed in the Logbook. Steps are also saved with the workout in Apple Health.
• Countdown Alert Fix: Fixed an issue with disabled countdown alerts for intervals with an estimated duration.

• Distance and pace can now be tracked on the iPhone for indoor treadmill workouts using Motion & Fitness Activity.
• Route Map Improvements: Weeding out bad GPS locations is more of an art than a science and we've made some changes to improve workout route maps.
• Siri Shortcuts for Apple Watch: Siri Shortcuts can now launch a timer on the Apple Watch.
• Other fixes and improvements.

• Running Workout Improvements for iPhone: Distance and pace are now tracked using Motion & Fitness Activity for both outdoor & indoor running workouts on the iPhone. Make sure to grant Motion & Fitness Activity permission for the most accurate distance and pace tracking.
• Bug fixes and improvements: The new Auto Pause feature for running and walking workouts would sometimes be triggered for other types of workouts. In this version only running and walking workouts will be eligble for auto pause. You can enable Auto Pause on the More tab -> Running, Walking & Cycling settings.

• Fixes a display issue in the Logbook where a lock icon would display for users that already have upgraded.

Other recent changes:
• Running Workout Improvements for iPhone: Distance and pace are now tracked using Motion & Fitness Activity for both outdoor & indoor running workouts on the iPhone. Make sure to grant Motion & Fitness Activity permission for the most accurate distance and pace tracking.
• Bug fixes and improvements: The new Auto Pause feature for running and walking workouts would sometimes be triggered for other types of workouts. In this version only running and walking workouts will be eligble for auto pause. You can enable Auto Pause on the More tab -> Running, Walking & Cycling settings.

• Route Map Improvements: Route map smoothing and improved filtering of invalid GPS locations.
• GPX file support for route maps: You can now share a GPX file of your route map. Just tap the share button on the route map screen.
• Bug fixes and improvements: The share card for the route map was improved to help ensure the entire route is shown when sharing the map of your route.
Includes an Apple Watch app fix to only track steps for running and walking workouts.

• Apple Watch Distance Display Improvements: Total distance on the Apple Watch is now displayed with two digits of precision (e.g. 2.25 mi).
• Running Splits: Splits are now displayed in the Logbook for new running and walking workouts.
Apple Watch Sync Improvements and bug fixes

• Quickly launch timers with iOS 14 Home Screen Widgets!
• New Airhorn Sounds
• Other fixes and improvements

Fix for some icons not appearing in iOS 13. Also, check out our other recent features:
• Quickly launch timers with iOS 14 Home Screen Widgets!
• New Airhorn Sounds
• Other fixes and improvements

Optimize Intervals Pro on the new M1 Macs. Also, check out our other recent features:
• Quickly launch timers with iOS 14 Home Screen Widgets!
• New Airhorn Sounds

• Timer Icons: Now you can personalize your timers even more with a wide variety of fitness and other fun icons.
• Improved Permission Handling.

Includes a fix for a crash when saving some timers. Also, check out our new features:
• Timer Icons: Now you can personalize your timers even more with a wide variety of fitness and other fun icons.
• Improved Permission Handling.
Now you can customize the Logbook to display total distance, pace, or active calories in your list of completed workouts. This makes it easier to compare workouts over time.
